original_data.question: An 11-year-old boy presents to your office with pitting edema and proteinuria exceeding 3.5g in 24 hours. You suspect that this patient has experienced a loss of polyanions in his glomerular basement membranes. Which of the following findings would confirm your diagnosis?

options.C: Negatively birefringent crystals in the urine

model_response:
This patient most likely has, or is developing, minimal change disease (MCD), also known as nil lesion. This is the most common cause of nephrotic syndrome in children. Patients with MCD have loss of polyanions in their glomerular basement membranes. This loss of negative charge results in selective albuminuria. Albumin is the least negatively charged of the plasma proteins. Other findings in MCD include periorbital edema, fatty casts in the urine, and lipiduria. WBC casts in the urine are associated with pyelonephritis. Bence-Jones proteins are light chains found in multiple myeloma. They are not associated with MCD.

Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Swelling due to excessive accumulation of fluid under the skin defined by a persistent indentation when pressure is applied to the swollen area. Causes include systemic conditions (e.g., heart failure, liver failure, or kidney failure) and local conditions affecting the extremities.
The presence of proteins in the urine, an indicator of KIDNEY DISEASES.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
A gradual decline in amount or activity.

A sheet of amorphous extracellular material upon which the basal surfaces of epithelial cells rest and is the covering surface of a glomerular capillary, interposed between the cellular elements and the underlying connective tissue.

The determination of the nature of a disease or condition, or the distinguishing of one disease or condition from another. Assessment may be made through physical examination, laboratory tests, or the likes. Computerized programs may be used to enhance the decision-making process.
